indications:
Indications hyperlipidaemias of types IIa, IIb, III, IV and V in patients who
have not responded adequately to diet and other appropriate measures;
primary prevention of cardiovascular disease in men with hyperlipidaemias
that have not responded to diet and other appropriate measures; also
see notes above
name: GEMFIBROZIL
cautions:
Cautions lipid profile, blood counts, and liver-function tests
before initiating long-term treatment; preferably avoid use with statins (high risk of rhabdomyolysis); correct hypothyroidism before initiating treatment (see Lipid-regulating Drugs); elderly; interactions: Appendix 1
(fibrates)
side-effects:
Side-effects gastro-intestinal disturbances; headache, fatigue,
vertigo; eczema, rash; less commonly atrial fibrillation; rarely pancreatitis, appendicitis, disturbances in liver
function including hepatitis and cholestatic jaundice, dizziness,
paraesthesia, sexual dysfunction, thrombocytopenia, anaemia, leucopenia,
eosinophilia, bone-marrow suppression, myalgia, myopathy, myasthenia,
myositis accompanied by increase in creatine kinase (discontinue if
raised significantly), blurred vision, exfoliative dermatitis, alopecia,
and photosensitivity)
doses:
1.2 g daily, usually in 2 divided doses; range 0.9–1.2 g
daily; child not recommended
pregnancy: Pregnancy manufacturers advise avoid—embryotoxicity in animal studies
